unit.description: Part of the 88th Infantry Division attachment and later the 1st Armored Division. Originally the 121st Field Artillery Regiment of the Wisconsin National Guard, redesignated as the 985th FA Battalion.

events.title: Arrival in North Africa
events.description: 985th Field Artillery Battalion arrives in Tunisia for staging before Italian Campaign.
events.source: On the Target, Summary of Operations

events.title: Salerno Landing
events.description: Battalion participates in Operation Avalanche, the Allied amphibious landing at Salerno, Italy.
events.source: On the Target, Summary of Operations

events.title: Arrives at Naples
events.description: 985th arrives at Naples harbor and moves to staging area near the city.

events.title: First Fire Mission
events.description: Battalion fires its first combat mission near Presenzano, beginning 510 days of combat operations.
events.source: On the Target, Summary of Operations

events.title: Winter Line Operations Begin
events.description: Battalion enters Winter Line operations in the mountainous terrain south of Monte Cassino.

events.title: Supporting San Pietro Assault
events.description: Heavy fire support for infantry assault on San Pietro Infine in the Liri Valley approach.

events.title: First Battle of Monte Cassino
events.description: 985th provides artillery support for the first Allied assault on the Gustav Line at Monte Cassino.

events.title: Cassino Abbey Bombed
events.description: Allied bombers destroy Monte Cassino Abbey. 985th continues supporting ground operations.

events.title: Third Battle of Monte Cassino
events.description: Massive artillery barrage supports third major assault on Cassino. 985th participates in the bombardment.

events.title: Operation Diadem Begins
events.description: Final offensive to break Gustav Line. 985th fires in support of the breakthrough operation.

events.title: Monte Cassino Falls
events.description: Polish forces capture the ruins of Monte Cassino. 985th advances north after months of bitter fighting.

events.title: Enters Rome
events.description: 985th enters Rome with the advancing Allied forces. Rome is the first Axis capital to fall.

events.title: Pursuit North of Rome
events.description: Battalion advances rapidly northward as German forces retreat toward the Gothic Line.

events.title: Reaches Florence Area
events.description: 985th arrives in the Florence area as Allies prepare to assault the Gothic Line defenses.

events.title: Gothic Line Assault
events.description: Battalion supports offensive operations against the heavily fortified Gothic Line in the Apennine Mountains.

events.title: 194 Consecutive Firing Days
events.description: 985th reaches milestone of 194 consecutive days firing combat missions, a remarkable endurance record.

events.title: Second Winter in Italy
events.description: Battalion holds positions in northern Italy through the harsh winter, maintaining fire support capability.

events.title: Spring Offensive Begins
events.description: Final Allied offensive in Italy. 985th supports the push across the Po Valley.

events.title: Bologna Liberated
events.description: Allied forces enter Bologna. 985th advances rapidly as German resistance collapses.

events.title: German Surrender in Italy
events.description: All German forces in Italy surrender unconditionally. 985th ceases combat operations after 510 days.

events.title: V-E Day
events.description: Victory in Europe Day. Battalion celebrates in northern Italy. John describes gondola ride in Venice.

events.title: French Croix de Guerre
events.description: 985th Field Artillery Battalion receives the French Croix de Guerre for distinguished service.
